Description: Copper alloy figure of a Dynastid rhinoceros-scarab beetle with an axial horn in front, curving upwards; elytra and prothorax are marked by simple incisions; forelegs and midlegs are barely outlined. The underside is gently concave as if the item was bound to be a decoration stuck or welded to a round object.
Curator's comments: Maybe one of the two "small bronze scarabs" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 74 § 70 ?
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 74 § 70) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.66, p.181, pl.23)
Condition: fair, though more corroded in front and right side; tip of right "foreleg" broken and missing
